endritpc, form my understanding, a reloaded release, is ripped and either packed for smaller size, or its made smaller. for example, the video's are too big, the person who made the reloaded image makes compresses the vids to take up less space and therefore, u have to download less. a dvd clone is just a iso image taken straight from a nfs shift 2 dvd in this case. It is not compressed, and it won't guaranty u that the key will work.

Shift 2 Unleashed Minimum System Requirements:

Required - Internet Connection
OS - Windows XP (SP3) / Vista (SP2)/ Windows 7
Processor - Intel CoreTM2 Duo 2.0 GHz / AMD X2 64 2.4GHz
Memory - 2.0 GB
Hard Drive - 7 GB
DVD Drive - 8x SPEED
Video Card - DirectX 9.0c Compatible 3D-accelerated 512 MB video card with Shader Model 3.0 or higher
Sound Card - DirectX 9.0c compatible
DirectX - Version 9.0c
Online Multiplayer - 512 Kbps or faster; 2-12 Players
Input - Keyboard, Mouse, Supported Game Controllers
Optional - USB Steering Wheel / Dual Analogue Gamepad

*Supported chipsets: ATI HD3 Series or greater; NVIDIA GeForce 8 Series or higher or greater

Laptop versions of these chipsets may work but are not supported. Updates to your video and sound card drivers may be required.

EA Download Manager Users require 8.16 GB additional space for temporary installation files

*NOTE - To install the game properly on Windows XP/Windows Vista/7, you will need administrator access to your machine

@jim_conte You probably dont meet the system requirements for the game. You listed your CPU, but you said nothing about your GPU (graphics card). This game has pretty high requirements, and since you have an Athlon II im going to assume your GPU is just as old, or built into the motherboard.  The game WILL launch, and can run, even if you do NOT meet the requirements. Often when someone doesnt have the graphics or processing (computer) power, they'll get a game that runs bad. Examples are laggy gameplay, laggy or non-responsive controls, choppy graphics/ missing frames, no sound or sound that goes in and out, etc. 
 As far as how you are playing the game, NO YOU DO NOT HAVE IT PROPERLY INSTALLED. On most games you will not be able to do what you did and get the game to work. What they mean is ater you install the game, you browse the game installer folder (the ISO or disk that you just installed the game from) Then find the folder that says "crack" or "reloaded" and instead of clicking the exe and launching the game like you did, Copy all of the files from the crack folder and place them in the directory where you installed the game. example c:program files/EA Games/Shift2Unleashed/ Or whereever the game was installed to. It will ask you to replace one or more files. click YES and the cracked files will now be placed in the game folder. Now launch the game from the EXE in the shift2unleashed folder, or on the desktop shortcut. Good luck.. I hope I helped.
